prompt: Generate 100 questions that I can use to interview anyone. In addition to questions about the interviewee, you can include small requests (e.g., talk about something you are passionate about, describe the room we are in, etc.) You should start with an introductory remark welcoming the interviewee and close with a concluding remark finishing the interview. Use {role} to address the interviewee.
introductory_remark: Welcome, {role}! Thank you for taking the time to join me today. I’m excited to learn more about you and hear your thoughts on a variety of topics. Let’s get started!
questions: Can you tell me a little about yourself?
Where did you grow up, and how has that shaped who you are today?
What is your educational or professional background?
What inspired you to pursue your current career or role?
Can you share a memorable experience from your childhood?
Who has been the most influential person in your life, and why?
What is one thing about you that most people don’t know?
What are some of your hobbies or interests outside of work?
How do you typically spend your weekends?
What is a skill or talent you have that you’re particularly proud of?
What does a typical day look like for you in your current role?
What do you enjoy most about your job?
What is the most challenging aspect of your work?
Can you describe a project or accomplishment you’re especially proud of?
How do you stay motivated and productive?
What is your approach to problem-solving?
How do you handle stress or pressure in the workplace?
What qualities do you think are essential for success in your field?
How do you continue to learn and grow professionally?
What advice would you give to someone aspiring to enter your field?
What are your core values, and how do they guide your decisions?
What does success mean to you?
How do you define happiness?
What motivates you to keep going during tough times?
What role does gratitude play in your life?
How do you approach making difficult decisions?
What is a cause or issue you feel strongly about?
How do you balance your personal and professional life?
What do you think is the most important quality in a leader?
How do you measure personal growth?
If you could have dinner with any historical figure, who would it be and why?
If you could live anywhere in the world, where would it be?
If you won the lottery tomorrow, what would you do?
If you could master any skill instantly, what would it be?
If you could change one thing about the world, what would it be?
If you could relive any moment in your life, which one would it be?
If you could switch lives with someone for a day, who would it be?
If you were stranded on a deserted island, what three items would you bring?
If you could time travel, would you go to the past or the future?
If you could write a book, what would it be about?
What is the best piece of advice you’ve ever received?
What is a mistake you’ve made, and what did you learn from it?
What is something you’ve accomplished that you never thought you could?
How do you typically handle failure?
What is a personal goal you’re currently working toward?
What is a fear you’ve overcome?
How do you celebrate your achievements?
What is a lesson you’ve learned the hard way?
What is something you’ve done recently that you’re proud of?
How do you stay true to yourself in challenging situations?
What is your favorite movie or TV show?
What is your favorite book or author?
What is your favorite type of music or band?
What is your favorite food or cuisine?
What is your dream vacation destination?
What is a fun fact about you?
What is your favorite holiday or tradition?
What is the most adventurous thing you’ve ever done?
What is your favorite way to relax?
What is a guilty pleasure you enjoy?
What do you think is the meaning of life?
How do you think technology is shaping the future?
What do you think is the biggest challenge facing society today?
How do you think we can create a more inclusive world?
What do you think is the key to building strong relationships?
How do you think people can make a positive impact on the world?
What do you think is the most important lesson people should learn?
How do you think we can better protect the environment?
What do you think is the role of art and creativity in society?
How do you think we can bridge cultural differences?
Can you describe the room we are in right now?
Can you talk about something you’re passionate about?
Can you share a story that has had a lasting impact on you?
Can you describe your ideal day?
Can you tell me about a time when you felt truly happy?
Can you describe a place that feels like home to you?
Can you share a memory that always makes you smile?
Can you describe your favorite childhood activity?
Can you talk about a time when you felt inspired?
Can you describe a moment when you felt completely at peace?
Where do you see yourself in five years?
What are your long-term goals or aspirations?
What is something you hope to achieve in the next year?
How do you envision your ideal future?
What legacy do you hope to leave behind?
What is a dream you’ve yet to pursue?
How do you plan to make a difference in the world?
What is something you’re looking forward to?
How do you hope to grow as a person in the coming years?
What is a habit or routine you’d like to develop?
What is one piece of advice you’d like to share with others?
What is something you’re grateful for today?
What is a question you wish more people would ask you?
What is a question you’ve always wanted to be asked?
What is something you’d like to learn more about?
What is a message you’d like to share with the world?
What is something you’d like to be remembered for?
What is a takeaway you hope people get from this conversation?
Is there anything you’d like to share?
What is one word you’d use to describe yourself?
concluding_remark: Thank you so much for sharing your time, thoughts, and stories with me today, {role}. It’s been a pleasure getting to know you better. I wish you all the best in your journey ahead!
